    • Method Detail

      • wordWrap

        public static java.lang.String wordWrap(java.lang.String string,
                        int lineLimit)
        Performs a wordwrap-like function on the given string limiting the line length to the given lineLimit. The lineLimit starts over based on the paragraph. It is defined by the System.getProperty("line.separator"). Words are defined by spaces.
        Parameters:
        string -
        lineLimit -
        Returns:

      • replaceInString

        public static java.lang.String replaceInString(java.lang.String string,
                               java.lang.String replace,
                               java.lang.String... items)
        Simple method. Read it like this: Replace "items" with "replace" in "string"
        Parameters:
        string - the string to replace items in
        replace - the text to replace the items with
        items - the items to replace
        Returns:
        the replaced string

      • isNullOrEmpty

        public static boolean isNullOrEmpty(java.lang.String... string)
        Calls isNull from OtherHelper on the given parameters first, then calls isEmpty on them. Returns true on first true result
        Parameters:
        string - the string/strings/array of strings to check
        Returns:

      • isEmpty

        public static boolean isEmpty(java.lang.String... string)
        Checks whether the given parameters are empty (or .equals(""))
        Parameters:
        string - the string/strings/array of strings to check
        Returns:
        true if any given string is empty

      • insertIntoString

        public static java.lang.String insertIntoString(java.lang.String string,
                                java.lang.String... inserts)
        Will insert the given inserts between each character of the given string. Here's an example: insertIntoString("1234", "a", "", "c", "+", "-", "32342") would return "a12c3+4". insertIntoString("1234", "", "hello", "", "world") would return "1hello23world4". Or a more useful example: insertIntoString("1231234567", "(", "", "", ") ", "", "", "-") would return "(123) 123-4567"
        Parameters:
        string -
        inserts -
        Returns:

      • shortenString

        public static java.lang.String shortenString(java.lang.String originalString,
                             int maxLength,
                             double percentStart)
        This method will make the display text for the current folders
        Parameters:
        originalString - the text to be shortened
        maxLength - maximum length of the string
        percentStart - the percentage of the string length to go before inserting the dots (for 50% give .5)
        Returns:
        the text to be displayed

      • splitBy

        public static <O> java.lang.String splitBy(java.lang.String separator,
                           java.util.List<O> objects)
        Convenience method. Allows you to give the splitBy method a list rather than an array or comma separated parameters.
        Parameters:
        separator - the separator to use between all given objects
        objects - the objects to separate. If null, returns "null"
        Returns:
        The objects.toString() separated by the separator

      • splitBy

        public static <O> java.lang.String splitBy(java.lang.String separator,
                           O... objects)
        Separates the given strings with the given separator (", " for example). Does not add the separator to the end of the list
        Parameters:
        separator - the separator to use between all given objects
        objects - the objects to separate. If null, returns "null"
        Returns:
        The objects.toString() separated by the separator

        string -
        times -
        Returns:
